messages.title: Change is coming to Chingford & Woodford Green
messages.content: Voting in this election is vital if you want to see a new way of doing things, where community comes first.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Huge cuts in police, youth, mental health services and early intervention have led to an increase in crime. Tory plans to replace officers with fewer PCSOs are failing. They would privatise the probation and dole services that actually do their jobs.
Every year, we send our children and grandchildren off to school with massive debt. Our schools are crumbling and many teachers are leaving.
I know how difficult it can be. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy. Locally, large chains dominate whilst small family business rates to be reduced.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Investment in elderly and social care – a world class Whipps Cross
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opening up Whipps Cross and upgrading it desperately needs facilities. Respected professional NHS staff need properly funded.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A final say on the Brexit deal
keyPolicies.policyDescription: It's time we brought it back to the people for a final say.
We need urgent climate investment to address air pollution, reduce greenhouse gases and redesign the North Circular.

mentions.tacticalSituation: 2017 election results: Conservative 49.1% Labour 43.9% LibDem 4.4% Green 2.6%

issues.brexitEurope: A final say on the Brexit deal.
issues.economy: Reviving our high streets. Large chains dominate whilst small family business rates to be reduced.
issues.education: High quality education for all. Our schools are crumbling and many teachers are leaving.
issues.environment: Tackling climate breakdown. We need urgent climate investment to reduce air pollution and greenhouse gases.

community.content: Change is coming to Chingford & Woodford Green. Voting in this election is vital if you want to see a new way of doing things, where community comes first.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have also worked as an employment expert supporting young people with the skills they need to thrive.

images.caption: Faiza Shaheen campaigning and meeting local people.

examples: 2017 election results: Conservative 49.1% Labour 43.9% LibDem 4.4% Green 2.6%
Change is coming to Chingford & Woodford Green. Voting in this election is vital if you want to see a new way of doing things, where community comes first.
Every year, we send our children and grandchildren off to school with massive debt.
Huge cuts in police, youth, mental health services and early intervention have led to an increase in crime.
I have also worked as an employment expert supporting young people with the skills they need to thrive.
Reviving our high streets. Large chains dominate whilst small family business rates to be reduced.
Change is coming to Chingford & Woodford Green. Voting in this election is vital if you want to see a new way of doing things, where community comes first.
A final say on the Brexit deal.
We need urgent climate investment to reduce air pollution and greenhouse gases.
High quality education for all. Our schools are crumbling and many teachers are leaving.
Huge cuts in police, youth, mental health services and early intervention have led to an increase in crime.

personalStories.story: From Greggs to Parliament. My roots are here – from riding the miniature train in Ridgeway Park and learning to read in North Chingford Library to my first job in Greggs on Chingford Mount. I attended Chingford CofE Primary and Chingford Foundation School before going to the University of Oxford and getting my doctorate. I was surrounded by inspiring people – teachers like Ms Osborne, and members of the local community – who believed in me and my ability to strive, succeed and stand up for what I believe in.

examples: Huge cuts in police, youth, mental health services and early intervention have led to an increase in crime.
Our schools are crumbling and many teachers are leaving.
Tory plans to replace officers with fewer PCSOs are failing. They would privatise the probation and dole services.
Vote Faiza or risk getting a Conservative MP again.
